intro: Solanum amatitlanense, commonly known as the Amatitlán nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are yellow when ripe, containing seeds within a fleshy pulp. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and relatively understudied species.
